name: NWN EE iOS - How to mod?
author: 0rangeAGENT

posts.author: 0rangeAGENT
posts.content:
I could use some help modding my game.  I’m having difficulty finding any modules and custom content that work.

To be clear and reiterate, my only option is to play NWN:EE, and only on my iOS device.

I’ve spent many hours searching for how to do this.  The single source I found explaining how is one Reddit post from months ago.  Here is a quote of the relevant info explaining how to mod the iOS version of the game:

‘Step 1: Head over to Neverwinter Vault and look for a module you want.
Step 2: Download the module, make sure to grab any extra files the module might require
Step 3: When the module finishes downloading save it into your files
Step 4: Extract the files from the zip into a separate folder (ONLY FILES IN THE SEPARATE FOLDER, NO SUB DIRECTORIES aka NO OTHER FOLDERS IN THE FOLDER)
Step 5: rename the folder to include an @ symbol at the beginning of it, ie: @eyeofthebeholder
Step 6: move this folder into your NVN/EE folder in your files
Step 7: Load up the game and click on the store, and hit customize, on the left side of the screen you should see your module, install it. It will appear under “other modules” when you start new game.’ [sic]

My first question is:  what are the good websites to find modules?  The only one I know of is neverwintervault.org, and every page loads painfully slow for me (my internet connection speed seems plenty fast in every other way I’ve used it so I don’t think that’s the issue).


My next question is:  will someone please spell out in great detail exactly how to install mods on iOS?

Using the instructions above I attempted to install numerous modules and types of custom content and so far I found exactly one that works:  Customize Character Override HAK (CCOH).  I love this one because I hate the way most default armors look.

Here is a short list of mods I tried that don’t work using the above technique:
* The Lord of Terror module
* CEP 2.6 (it installs with no error messages, but it doesn’t do anything?)
* several portrait packs (again, no errors but no new portraits are available to choose in game)

I wonder if I have to limit myself to EE only mods, or if there are some other basic filters I need to consider that I am currently unaware of.  Is there a defined list of mods that are known to work with NWN:EE iOS?

Part of my desperation stems from the fact I only have about 20 free hours per week to play around with this.  I might even figure it out myself in a few months time....

Please help me out?  I am in love with this game and will really bummed out if I’m limited to the OC, expansions, and official modules only.

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
Alright, OrangeAGENT, I can't promise anything, but I might be able to help a bit (I am to technology what Minsc is to diplomacy).

First of all, are we clear about the difference between "modules" and "modifications"? Both tend to be unhelpfully shortened to "mods". Using your 3 examples of "failed mods", Lord of Terror is a module, and requires a CEP modification to work. Unfortunately, it needs an earlier one than you've loaded (check the Lord of Terror thread in this forum for details on which one you do need). The CEP modification you have loaded won't "do" anything - what it will do is allow you to play the newer modules you might want to load up. Afraid I'm not going to be much use as far as the portrait packs go, but I suspect they, too, are modifications rather than modules, so you'll only be able to use them when playing an appropriate module.

In essence, a module is what you play: a modification alters the experience of playing. We've tried to be helpful here in the Guild by putting modifications under the heading "Add-Ons".

Now, over to people who know what they're on about...

Cheers

posts.author: 0rangeAGENT
posts.content:
Thank you for your quick reply, Stagmeister.  You are right, I did use the term “mod” loosely to mean both the nouns of modules and modifications, as well as the verb to install both of those things.  Going forward I’ll use the term “custom content” when I’m talking about both.

I tried two more modules today and had one failure and one success.  I’ll make a list here (and try to edit to update as I go) in case there’s someone else in my situation in the future.  This is me time traveling:

Custom Content that works on iOS:
• Customize Character Override HAK (CCOH) (Add-On)
• The Halls of Advanced Training Deluxe - HotU+SoU Edition (Module)

I’m going to keep trying to get some of the big name modules I keep hearing about to work.  Lord of Terror is still on my list, along with Aielund and Swordflight.

posts.content:
I just read through almost the entire LoT thread.  Saw something that intrigued me and I’d love confirmation here if possible:

Can I install both CEP v1x and CEP 2.65 without breaking anything? That is, be able to play both LoT and a newer mod without having to juggle CEP installs?

That doesn’t work for me, web, I tried.  It seems kind of random now, sometimes all the like / edit / etc buttons are there but most of the time not.

Good news is now I have figured out how to install modules!  I just had the bad luck of initially trying a string of modules that didn’t work.  I still can’t get most add-one to work except those built into modules.

posts.author: 0rangeAGENT
posts.content:
It looks like I spoke too soon.  I got Lord of Terror installed and working.  Made a wemic barbarian with all default stats to make sure it loads and talked to the first NPC.  All good.  I uninstalled (will do all my playing once I get the new phone in a couple weeks).

Currently I have 4 things installed:  cep 1 complete, cep 265, ccoh, and halls of advanced training.

Next one on my list is Caereena, since it’s only two files I thought it would go quick.  Did everything I was supposed to then installed.  As soon as I try to create a character or select premise character I get:

“Could not lord the Module.
Missing required HAK file.
Check your log file for the list of missing hak packs.”

I check the log file and it says I am missing pacific 1.hak and pacific 2.hak.  But I’m not missing those.  They are there.

I uninstalled Caereena.  Installed Mines of Twin Summit.  MTS1 loses fine, used a pregen toon and talked to NPC and entered the campaign.  Fine ✔.  Tried to start MTS2, select pregen/create toon gave me the same error message.  Log file showed a missing hak pack that was not actually missing.

Now I’m stumped.  I’m kind of busy off and on the rest of today but I’ll try to install a few other modules see what happens.
